# First Filter
```{r filter 1}
bp_bb <- bp_bb %>%
  mutate(EnergyBMR_Day1 = na_if(EnergyBMR_Day1, 997) %>% na_if(998),
         EnergyBMR_Day2 = na_if(EnergyBMR_Day2, 997) %>% na_if(998),
         EnergyBMR = (EnergyBMR_Day1 + EnergyBMR_Day2)/2) %>%
  filter(
    Age >= 18, 
    HypertensionStatus == 5,
    BodyMass != 4,
    (is.na(EnergyBMR) | EnergyBMR >= 0.9))

bsp_bhh <- bsp_bhh %>% 
  mutate(EnergyBMR_Day1 = na_if(EnergyBMR_Day1, 997) %>% na_if(998),
         EnergyBMR_Day2 = na_if(EnergyBMR_Day2, 997) %>% na_if(998),
         EnergyBMR = (EnergyBMR_Day1 + EnergyBMR_Day2)/2) %>%
  filter(
    Age >= 18, 
    BodyMass != 4,
    !HouseID %in% bcn$HouseID[bcn$MedicalCondition %in% c(7, 20)],
    (is.na(EnergyBMR) | EnergyBMR >= 0.9))
```

raw_data <- bind_rows(bp_bb,bsp_bhh)

# Na values + New Variables + Type Conversion
```{r navalue_new_typeconversion}
selected_data <- selected_data %>%
  mutate(
    across(c(Gender, SocialStatus, SmokeStatus), as.factor),
    BMI = na_if(BMI, 98) %>% na_if(99),
    Systolic = na_if(Systolic, 0) %>% na_if(998) %>% na_if(999),
    Diastolic = na_if(Diastolic, 0) %>% na_if(998) %>% na_if(999),
    Potassium = (Potassium_Day1 + Potassium_Day2) / 2, 
    Sodium = (Sodium_Day1 + Sodium_Day2) / 2,
    FiberEnergy = (FiberEnergy_Day1 + FiberEnergy_Day2)/2,
    CarbonhydrateEnergy = (CarbonhydrateEnergy_Day1 + CarbonhydrateEnergy_Day2) / 2,
    AlcoholPercentage = (AlcoholPercentage_Day1 + AlcoholPercentage_Day2) /2,
    PotassiumSodiumRatio = Sodium / Potassium # Name
    ) %>% 
  select(PersonID,HouseID, SocialStatus, Age, Gender, BMI, Systolic, Diastolic, SmokeStatus, AlcoholPercentage, PotassiumSodiumRatio, FiberEnergy, CarbonhydrateEnergy, Identity)
```

```

# Outliers and New Variables
```{r variable creation and outliers}
normal_ranges <- list(Systolic = c(90, 180),
                      Diastolic = c(60, 120),
                      BMI = c(16, 47.5), 
                      PotassiumSodiumRatio = c(0, 4), 
                      AlcoholPercentage = c(0, 85), 
                      CarbonhydrateEnergy = c(0, 100), 
                      FiberEnergy = c(0, 100))

selected_data <- selected_data %>%
  filter(
    (is.na(Systolic) | (Systolic >= normal_ranges$Systolic[1] & Systolic <= normal_ranges$Systolic[2])),
    (is.na(Diastolic) | (Diastolic >= normal_ranges$Diastolic[1] & Diastolic <= normal_ranges$Diastolic[2])),
    (is.na(BMI) | (BMI >= normal_ranges$BMI[1] & BMI <= normal_ranges$BMI[2])),
    (is.na(AlcoholPercentage) | (AlcoholPercentage >= normal_ranges$AlcoholPercentage[1] & AlcoholPercentage <= normal_ranges$AlcoholPercentage[2])),
    (is.na(CarbonhydrateEnergy) | (CarbonhydrateEnergy >= normal_ranges$CarbonhydrateEnergy[1] & CarbonhydrateEnergy <= normal_ranges$CarbonhydrateEnergy[2])),
    (is.na(FiberEnergy) | (FiberEnergy >= normal_ranges$FiberEnergy[1] & FiberEnergy <= normal_ranges$FiberEnergy[2])),
    (is.na(PotassiumSodiumRatio) | (PotassiumSodiumRatio >= normal_ranges$PotassiumSodiumRatio[1] & PotassiumSodiumRatio <= normal_ranges$PotassiumSodiumRatio[2]))
  ) %>%
  mutate(
    Hypertension = as.factor(case_when(
      Systolic >= 120 | Diastolic >= 80 ~ 1,
      TRUE ~ 0)))
```

# Regression Imputation
```{r regression imputation, fig.height = 5, fig.width= 11}
selected_data$BMI[is.na(selected_data$BMI)] <- lm(BMI ~ Gender + SocialStatus + Age + PotassiumSodiumRatio + FiberEnergy + CarbonhydrateEnergy + AlcoholPercentage + SmokeStatus + Identity, data = selected_data, na.action = na.exclude) %>% 
  predict(newdata = selected_data[is.na(selected_data$BMI), ])

selected_data$Systolic[is.na(selected_data$Systolic)] <- lm(Systolic ~ Gender + SocialStatus + Age + BMI + PotassiumSodiumRatio + FiberEnergy + CarbonhydrateEnergy + AlcoholPercentage + SmokeStatus + Identity, data = selected_data, na.action = na.exclude) %>% 
  predict(newdata = selected_data[is.na(selected_data$Systolic), ])

selected_data$Diastolic[is.na(selected_data$Diastolic)] <- lm(Diastolic ~ Gender + SocialStatus + Age + BMI + Systolic + PotassiumSodiumRatio + FiberEnergy + CarbonhydrateEnergy + AlcoholPercentage + SmokeStatus + Identity, data = selected_data, na.action = na.exclude) %>% 
  predict(newdata = selected_data[is.na(selected_data$Diastolic), ])
```

````{r}
numeric_data <- selected_data %>% select_if(is.numeric)
preprocess_params <- preProcess(numeric_data, method = c("center", "scale"))
scaled_numeric_data <- predict(preprocess_params, numeric_data)
normalized_data <- bind_cols(scaled_numeric_data, selected_data %>% select_if(Negate(is.numeric)))

# Assuming normalized_data is already created and contains the relevant columns
x_train <- model.matrix(Systolic ~ Age + BMI + SocialStatus + Gender + SmokeStatus +
                          AlcoholPercentage + FiberEnergy + CarbonhydrateEnergy +
                          Identity + PotassiumSodiumRatio, data = normalized_data)[, -1]  # Exclude intercept
y_train <- normalized_data$Systolic

# Fit the LASSO model
lasso_model <- glmnet(x_train, y_train, alpha = 1)

# Perform cross-validation to find the best lambda
set.seed(123)  # For reproducibility
cv_model <- cv.glmnet(x_train, y_train, alpha = 1)

# Extract the best lambda
best_lambda <- cv_model$lambda.min

# Make predictions using the best lambda
predicted_values <- predict(cv_model, newx = x_train, s = best_lambda)
```

````{r}
library(dplyr)
library(glmnet)

# Assuming normalized_data is already created and contains the relevant columns

# 1. Fit the LASSO model with all variables
x_train_full <- model.matrix(Systolic ~ Age + BMI + SocialStatus + Gender + 
                                SmokeStatus + AlcoholPercentage + 
                                FiberEnergy + CarbonhydrateEnergy + 
                                Identity + PotassiumSodiumRatio, 
                              data = normalized_data)[, -1]  # Exclude intercept
y_train <- normalized_data$Systolic  

# Fit the LASSO model
lasso_model_full <- glmnet(x_train_full, y_train, alpha = 1)

# Cross-validation to find the best lambda
set.seed(123)  # For reproducibility
cv_model_full <- cv.glmnet(x_train_full, y_train, alpha = 1)

# Extract the best lambda for the full model
best_lambda_full <- cv_model_full$lambda.min

# Make predictions using the best lambda for the full model
predicted_values_full <- predict(cv_model_full, newx = x_train_full, s = best_lambda_full)

# Calculate MSE for the full model
mse_full <- mean((predicted_values_full - y_train)^2)

# 2. Fit the LASSO model without FiberEnergy and CarbohydrateEnergy
x_train_reduced <- model.matrix(Systolic ~ Age + BMI + SocialStatus + Gender + 
                                   SmokeStatus + AlcoholPercentage + 
                                   Identity + PotassiumSodiumRatio, 
                                 data = normalized_data)[, -1]  # Exclude intercept

# Fit the LASSO model without FiberEnergy and CarbohydrateEnergy
lasso_model_reduced <- glmnet(x_train_reduced, y_train, alpha = 1)

# Cross-validation to find the best lambda for the reduced model
cv_model_reduced <- cv.glmnet(x_train_reduced, y_train, alpha = 1)

# Extract the best lambda for the reduced model
best_lambda_reduced <- cv_model_reduced$lambda.min

# Make predictions using the best lambda for the reduced model
predicted_values_reduced <- predict(cv_model_reduced, newx = x_train_reduced, s = best_lambda_reduced)

# Calculate MSE for the reduced model
mse_reduced <- mean((predicted_values_reduced - y_train)^2)

# 3. Compare the models
comparison <- data.frame(
  Model = c("Full Model", "Reduced Model"),
  MSE = c(mse_full, mse_reduced)
)

print(comparison)
```

```{r}
# 1. Split data into training and test sets
set.seed(123)  # For reproducibility
train_index <- createDataPartition(normalized_data$Systolic, p = 0.8, list = FALSE)
train_data <- normalized_data[train_index, ]
test_data <- normalized_data[-train_index, ]

# Create indices for 5-fold cross-validation with 3 repeats
set.seed(123)  # For reproducibility
folds <- createMultiFolds(train_data$Systolic, k = 5, times = 3)

# Define a function to calculate RMSE, R-squared, and MAE
calc_metrics <- function(actual, predicted) {
  rmse <- sqrt(mean((actual - predicted)^2))
  r_squared <- cor(actual, predicted)^2
  mae <- mean(abs(actual - predicted))
  return(c(RMSE = rmse, R_squared = r_squared, MAE = mae))
}

# 2. Fit the LASSO model with all variables and evaluate
x_train_full <- model.matrix(Systolic ~ Age + BMI + SocialStatus + Gender + 
                                SmokeStatus + AlcoholPercentage + 
                                FiberEnergy + CarbonhydrateEnergy + 
                                Identity + PotassiumSodiumRatio, 
                              data = train_data)[, -1]
y_train <- train_data$Systolic  

# Perform cross-validation with custom index for the full model
cv_model_full <- train(x_train_full, y_train, method = "glmnet", 
                       trControl = trainControl(method = "boot", 
                                                index = folds))

# Make predictions on the test set
x_test_full <- model.matrix(Systolic ~ Age + BMI + SocialStatus + Gender + 
                               SmokeStatus + AlcoholPercentage + 
                               FiberEnergy + CarbonhydrateEnergy + 
                               Identity + PotassiumSodiumRatio, 
                             data = test_data)[, -1]
y_test <- test_data$Systolic

predictions_full <- predict(cv_model_full, newdata = as.data.frame(x_test_full))

# Calculate metrics for the full model
metrics_full <- calc_metrics(y_test, predictions_full)

# 3. Fit the LASSO model without FiberEnergy and CarbohydrateEnergy and evaluate
x_train_reduced <- model.matrix(Systolic ~ Age + BMI + SocialStatus + Gender + 
                                   SmokeStatus + AlcoholPercentage + 
                                   Identity + PotassiumSodiumRatio, 
                                 data = train_data)[, -1]

# Perform cross-validation with custom index for the reduced model
cv_model_reduced <- train(x_train_reduced, y_train, method = "glmnet", 
                          trControl = trainControl(method = "boot", 
                                                   index = folds))

# Make predictions on the test set
x_test_reduced <- model.matrix(Systolic ~ Age + BMI + SocialStatus + Gender + 
                                  SmokeStatus + AlcoholPercentage + 
                                  Identity + PotassiumSodiumRatio, 
                                data = test_data)[, -1]

predictions_reduced <- predict(cv_model_reduced, newdata = as.data.frame(x_test_reduced))

# Calculate metrics for the reduced model
metrics_reduced <- calc_metrics(y_test, predictions_reduced)

# 4. Compare metrics
comparison <- data.frame(
  Model = c("Full Model", "Reduced Model"),
  RMSE = c(metrics_full['RMSE'], metrics_reduced['RMSE']),
  R_Squared = c(metrics_full['R_squared'], metrics_reduced['R_squared']),
  MAE = c(metrics_full['MAE'], metrics_reduced['MAE'])
)

print(comparison)
```
